revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name = Aleksandr Kosmodemyansky |birth_date = 27 July 1925 |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1945|4|13|1925|7|27}} |birth_place = [[Osino-Gay]],
near of [[Tambov]], [[USSR]] |death_place = The Kaporner Heath near [[Metgethen]], [[East Prussia]], Germany |image = The Soviet Union 1969 CPA 3727 stamp (World War II Hero First Lieutenant of the Guard Aleksandr Kosmodemyansky).jpg |image_size = |caption = The Soviet Union 1969 CPA 3727 stamp (World War II Hero First Lieutenant of the Guard Aleksandr Kosmodemyansky) |nickname = |allegiance = {{USSR}} |branch =[[Red Army]] |serviceyears=1942-1945 |rank =Senior lieutenant |commands = |battles =[[World War II]] *[[East Prussian Offensive]] |awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} |laterwork = |unit = [[42nd Guards Heavy Tank Brigade]]
[[350th Guards Heavy Self-Propelled Artillery Regiment]]}} '''Aleksandr Anatolyevich Kosmodemyansky''' ({{lang-ru|Алекса́ндр Анато́льевич Космодемья́нский}}; July 27, 1925 – April 13, 1945) was a [[First Lieutenant|first lieutenant]] and a [[hero of the Soviet Union]], who was bestowed this title posthumously after having been killed during [[World War II]] during the capture of the settlement of Vierbrüderkrug, in the Kaporner Heath near [[Metgethen]], just west of [[Königsberg]], [[East Prussia]], [[Nazi Germany|Germany]]. He was the brother of [[Zoya Kosmodemyanskaya]]. The settlement of [[imeni Alexandra Kosmodemyanskogo]] in [[Kaliningrad Oblast]] was renamed after him in 1956. The minor planet [[1977 Shura]] was named in his honour, while [[1793 Zoya]] and [[2072 Kosmodemyanskaya]] were named for his sister and for his mother, Lyubov Kosmodemyanskaya, respectively. [[File:Могила Героя Советского Союза Александра Космодемьянского.JPG|thumb|190px|left|Aleksandr's tomb at the [[Novodevichy Cemetery]], Moscow]] {{clear|left}} == References == {{reflist|refs= {{cite book |url=http://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-540-29925-7_1978 |title=Dictionary of Minor Planet Names – (1977) Shura |last=Schmadel |first=Lutz D. |publisher=Springer Berlin Heidelberg |page=159 |date=2003 |isbn=978-3-540-29925-7 |accessdate=November 2015}} {{cite book |url=http://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-540-29925-7_1794 |title=Dictionary of Minor Planet Names – (1793) Zoya |last=Schmadel |first=Lutz D. |publisher=Springer Berlin Heidelberg |page=143 |date=2003 |isbn=978-3-540-29925-7 |accessdate=November 2015}} {{cite book |url=http://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-540-29925-7_2073 |title=Dictionary of Minor Planet Names – (2072) Kosmodemyanskaya |last=Schmadel |first=Lutz D. |publisher=Springer Berlin Heidelberg |page=168 |date=2003 |isbn=978-3-540-29925-7 |accessdate=November 2015}} }} == External links == {{commons category|Aleksandr Kosmodemyansky}} *[http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=419 warheroes.ru - Aleksandr Kosmodemyansky] (ru) {{DEFAULTSORT:Kosmodemyansky, Alksandr}} [[Category:1925 births]] [[Category:1945 deaths]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel killed in World War II]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Patriotic War, 1st class]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Patriotic War, 2nd class]] [[Category:People from Tambov Governorate]] {{Soviet-bio-stub}} {{russia-mil-bio-stub}}
